intro: Hemibaccharis simplex, commonly known as Brazilian bush, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Hemibaccharis simplex is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
